name: Tacos Gobernador
author: Yoly
summary: These tacos originated in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, Mexico. It is said that the governor of Sinaloa loved shrimp and quesadillas so the chef of a well known restaurant created these, a cross between a shrimp taco and a quesadilla. And so these were named Tacos Gobernador ('Governor Tacos')
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 pound raw shrimp - peeled, deveined, and cut into small pieces
directions: Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat
Add onions and serrano and cook until onions are soft and translucent, 4 to 5 minutes
Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute
Add tomatoes to the skillet and cook until they have softened, about 3 minutes
Cook until shrimp turns pink, 2 to 3 minutes
Season with more salt and pepper
Divide shrimp mixture into 8 equal portions
Melt 1/2 teaspoon bacon drippings in a cast iron skillet over medium-low heat
Add 1 1/2 tablespoons cheese and 1 portion shrimp mixture to one side of the tortilla
Fold over and cook until tortilla is semi-crisp and cheese has started to melt, 3 to 4 minutes
Flip taco onto other side and cook to desired crispiness, 2 to 3 minutes more
